programme.title: The Good Lie
programme.desc: An employment counselor (Reese Witherspoon) dedicates her life to helping a group of Sudanese orphans find jobs and adjust to their new lives in America.

programme.title: King's Ransom
programme.desc: An obnoxious businessman (Anthony Anderson) arranges his own kidnapping to foil his wife's (Kellita Smith) impending divorce settlement.

programme.title: The Queen Boxer
programme.desc: An avenger (Judy Lei) of murder destroys a crime ring with her kung fu.

programme.title: Blackenstein
programme.desc: A war veteran (Joe DeSue) whose limbs were medically restored becomes a killer when his physician's (John Hart) aid switches his medication.

programme.title: Solomon King
programme.desc: A man (Sal Watts) declares war on the Arabs who murdered his ex-lover.

programme.title: My Dad's a Soccer Mom
programme.desc: Cut from his NFL football team, a man starts bonding with his young daughter (Skai Jackson) and encourages her to play soccer.

programme.title: My Other Mother
programme.desc: Adopted as a child, an anchorwoman (Essence Atkins) reconnects with her birth mother (Lynn Whitfield) and extended family when she attends the funeral of her father.

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: A writer (Erica Tazel) who has sworn off trying to find love is unexpectedly swept off her feet by a seemingly perfect man (Columbus Short). Things get complicated when she learns he works for a dating service.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.sub-title: My Big Bro Cause My Divorce
programme.desc: Devin is suing his brother Danny for breaking up his marriage. Danny told him that he saw his wife cheating.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Katie is suing her father for access to her trust fund; Robert says the parameters of the trust fund are clear and it states Katie can have full access when she turns 25 years old.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: On November 3, 2011, while two men were headed to work, one was shot during a robbery and was fortunate to survive; on November 6, 2011, while a firefighter was inspecting fire hydrants, a thief stuck a gun in his face and demanded his jewelry.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: Isaac Hardges was paralyzed from a shooting; Moussa Salti was working at his market when thieves entered the store.

programme.title: Love Jones
programme.desc: Emotionally vulnerable Chicagoans (Larenz Tate, Nia Long) carry on a torrid affair but deny their burgeoning love.

programme.title: Woo
programme.desc: Friends arrange a blind date for a mismatched couple, an insecure law clerk (Tommy Davidson) and a sassy extrovert (Jada Pinkett Smith).
